results.title: Enough About Gram Parsons’s Death. It’s Time to Celebrate His Music.
results.abstract: The country-rock pioneer died 50 years ago at age 26 with two influential solo albums to his name, leaving a legion of “what if”s behind.

media.caption: In the half-century since Gram Parsons’s untimely death, the story of his final days has been told and retold, embellished and subsequently fact-checked.

results.title: Want to Believe in Yourself? ‘Mattering’ Is Key.
results.abstract: This overlooked concept has been linked to better relationships — with oneself and others.

results.title: Sea Lion Escapes From Central Park Zoo Enclosure During Flooding
results.abstract: Sally, the marine mammal, got a chance to briefly explore the world outside her pool when the zoo grounds were flooded by the heavy rains.

media.caption: The Central Park Zoo’s sea lions in drier times. One of the zoo’s sea lions, Sally, briefly got out of the pool where she is kept on Friday during the flooding rain.

results.adx_keywords: Black People;Hate Crimes;Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;vis-photo;Atlanta (Ga)
results.byline: By Rick Rojas and Alyssa Pointer
results.title: In a ‘City Too Busy to Hate,’ New Attention to an Overlooked Race Massacre
results.abstract: Researchers say that mob violence against Black residents in 1906 played a role in Atlanta’s evolution, whether residents knew it or not.

media.caption: The gravestone of George Wilder, center, at the South-View Cemetery in Atlanta. He was killed during a race massacre in the city in 1906.

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Pregnancy and Childbirth;Women and Girls;Medicine and Health;Shutdowns (Institutional);Suits and Litigation (Civil);Black People;Midwives and Doulas;Oasis Family Birthing Center;Alabama Department of Public Health;American Civil Liberties Union;Alabama
results.byline: By Emily Baumgaertner and Erin Schaff
results.title: For Black Mothers, Birthing Centers, Once a Refuge, Become a Battleground
results.abstract: Some say the facilities, which focus on autonomy in childbirth, could lead to better health outcomes — but officials are tightening rules, citing risk.

media.caption: Karneshia Jemison in a room of the birth center where she was hoping to deliver her baby, in Birmingham, Ala. Oasis Family Birthing Center was closed by the state in June despite its perfect safety record.

results.title: Emma Thompson Is Right: The Word ‘Content’ Is Rude
results.abstract: The term may be popular in an age of blurring lines between platforms, but the Hollywood strikes have shown how the phrase can devalue creative work.

media.caption: “To hear people talk about ‘content’ makes me feel like the stuffing inside a sofa cushion,” Emma Thompson said at a conference.

results.byline: By Karen Yourish and Lazaro Gamio
results.title: How the Shutdown Holdouts Have Antagonized McCarthy Before
results.abstract: Some of Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s most persistent tormentors assembled Friday to defeat a stopgap spending measure to avoid a government shutdown, the latest episode in a pattern of blocking his efforts in the House.

results.byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Stuart A. Thompson
results.title: Fact Checkers Take Stock of Their Efforts: ‘It’s Not Getting Better’
results.abstract: The momentum behind organizations that aim to combat online falsehoods has started to taper off.

media.caption: “It’s not getting better,” said Tai Nalon, a journalist who runs the Brazilian fact-checking company Aos Fatos, of efforts to combat falsehoods.

results.abstract: And that is just the tip of the iceberg.

results.title: ‘Reservation Dogs’ Was a Coming-of-All-Ages Masterpiece
results.abstract: In the ending of the FX comedy-drama, preserving the bonds among generations is a radical, magical act.

media.caption: Willie Jack (Paulina Alexis), left, and Hokti (Lily Gladstone) in the series finale. Often in the series, it is the children who force the grown-ups to reconnect and confront their emotions.

results.title: What Kind of Person Has a Closet Full of Nazi Memorabilia?

results.title: In an Israeli Oasis, a Model for Peace, if Messy and Imperfect
results.abstract: In a small village, Jews and Arabs have chosen to live side by side, share power and imagine a more hopeful future. But even here, the agonies of the conflict can’t be escaped entirely.

results.title: Anthropology Conference Drops a Panel Defending Sex as Binary
results.abstract: Organizers said the session did not have scientific merit and was harmful to transgender members. Critics of the move say the discipline is unfriendly to dissenting views on the subject.

media.caption: Kathleen Lowrey, an associate professor at the University of Alberta, organized a panel called, “Let’s Talk About Sex Baby: Why Biological Sex Remains a Necessary Analytic Category in Anthropology.”

results.title: Beloved Tree in England Is Felled in ‘Act of Vandalism’
results.abstract: Local people and tourists mourned the loss of one of Britain’s most photographed trees, which stood for hundreds of years in a dip in Hadrian’s Wall. The police said they made a second arrest on Friday.

media.caption: The felled tree at Sycamore Gap, beside Hadrian’s Wall, on Thursday. The authorities said they had arrested a teenager and a man in connection with what they described as an act of vandalism.
